intro: Lucuma sericea, commonly known as the silky lucuma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. Its fruit, which is typically harvested when mature, is oval-shaped and has a sweet, nutty flavor. Lucuma sericea is valued both for its ornamental qualities and its potential culinary uses.
